brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn more about the safety and dosing of rifampin in infants.

detailed_description.textblock: Pharmacokinetics and safety of rifampin will be studied in term and preterm infants who are receiving rifampin per standard of care.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of the first dose to 3 days after the last dose; serious adverse events will be collected from the first dose of rifampin to 7 days after the last dose of rifampin.

arm_group.description: Cohort 1 will include infants who will be receiving up to 4 doses rifampin per study protocol.
Cohort 2: Receiving rifampin per standard of care

intervention.description: Infants who will be receiving up to 4 doses of rifampin per protocol(Cohort 1) Cohort 1: Dosing will be as follows: GA at birth < 32 weeks - PNA < 14 days: 10 mg/kg QD GA at birth < 32 weeks - PNA ≥ 14 days: 15 mg/kg QD GA at birth ≥ 32 weeks - PNA < 14 days: 15 mg/kg QD GA at birth ≥ 32 weeks - PNA ≥ 14 days: 20 mg/kg QD

criteria.textblock:
Cohort 1:
- Suspected systemic infection
- Infant < 121 days of age at the time of 1st dose of rifampin administration
- Sufficient intravascular access (either peripheral or central) to receive rifampin.
Cohort 2:
- Receiving rifampin per local standard of care.
- Infant < 121 days of age at the time of 1st dose of rifampin administration
Exclusion Criteria:
Cohort 1:
- History of allergic reactions to rifampin
- Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) greater than 3 times upper limit of normal
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) greater than 3 times upper limit of normal
- Serum creatinine greater than 1.7 mg.dL
- Urine output < 0.5 mL/hr/kg over the prior 24 hours
- Any condition which would make the subject, in the opinion of the investigator, unsuitable for the study
